did.abstract: The papers consist of a typed manuscript, "The trials of Alger Hiss, as reported by James Bell, Time Incorporated," 734 pages in 2 volumes. The contents include trial I, June 1, 1949-July 8, 1949, and trial II, November 22, 1949-January 25, 1950.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Time, Inc., and Henry R. Luce, 1954.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
The entire collection is available on microfilm. Patrons must use FILM HM 85 instead of the originals.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James Adrian Bell Papers (MS 284). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Bell worked as a journalist and was a correspondent for Time, Inc. from 1942-1948. He served as White House correspondent from 1948-1950. Bell was bureau chief in the Middle East, 1951-1954; Central Europe, 1954-1956 and 1961-1966; China and Southeast Asia, 1956-1959; Africa, 1959-1961; New York, 1966-1968; Rome, 1968-1973; Atlanta, 1973-1976; and Boston, 1976-.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of a typed manuscript, "The trials of Alger Hiss, as reported by James Bell, Time Incorporated," 734 pages in 2 volumes. The contents include trial I, June 1, 1949-July 8, 1949, and trial II, November 22, 1949-January 25, 1950.
